intro: Ridsdalea papuana, commonly known as the Papuan ridsdalea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and leathery leaves. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in coastal or lowland areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
